alert.note: Alert for Stillwater (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 23 at 4:51PM MDT until June 23 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL STILLWATER COUNTY... At 451 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Absarokee. Radar estimates between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area over the next hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, rural roads, as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Absarokee. This includes the following streams and drainages... Grove Creek, Fishtail Creek, Orson Coulee, Stillwater River, Trout Creek, Butcher Creek, Beaver Creek, Rosebud Creek, South Fork Grove Creek, East Rosebud Creek, Jack Stone Creek, Cow Creek, Spring Creek and Davidson Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
